title: Cycle of Judges
objective: Recognize covenant faithfulness cycle in Judges

segments.audio_script: This is lesson sixteen. You are studying the cycle of judges. Lesson fifteen examined conquest and covenant fulfillment.

Israel enters promised land but lacks centralized leadership. Judges arise to address crises. The period demonstrates recurring pattern. Israel forgets God, falls into oppression, cries out, God sends deliverer.
Judges 2 describes the pattern explicitly. The cycle repeats multiple times. Apostasy leads to punishment. Repentance brings deliverance. The cycle shows covenant relationship is dynamic not static.
Key themes: apostasy means turning away from God. Covenant cycle repeats throughout history. God responds to repentance with deliverance. Judges are covenant restorers.
What is the pattern described in Judges 2:11-19?
segments.correct_answer: Israel apostasizes, God punishes, Israel repents, God delivers

segments.audio_script: This completes lesson sixteen. You studied the cycle in Judges. Next lesson examines the establishment of kingship.

vocabulary.definition: Deliberate turning away from God and breach of covenant commitment
Covenant restorers whom God raises up to deliver Israel from oppression and return to faithfulness

study_notes: The judges period shows covenant as dynamic relationship subject to violation and restoration. It demonstrates God's patience and repeated offer of grace.
